faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without citizenship restrictions. UK, EU, and international buyers enjoy identical legal rights and property protections as Spanish nationals. The purchase process involves straightforward legal procedures through a licensed gestoría (property management firm) and Spanish notary. Most international buyers successfully navigate purchases within 60-90 days with appropriate professional guidance.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond purchase price, typical costs include: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registration (0.5%), and optional legal/gestoria fees (1-2%). Mortgage arrangements for non-residents typically require 20-30% deposit with rates favorable compared to UK lending. De jaarlijkse onroerende voorheffing remain minimal compared to UK council tax equivalents. Comprehensive cost breakdowns are available through qualified local legal advisors.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, international buyers routinely secure Spanish mortgages through major banks including BBVA, CaixaBank, and Santander. Non-residents typically require 20-30% deposit with mortgage terms available up to 25 years. Interest rates remain competitive compared to UK lending, particularly for European buyers. Documentation requirements include income verification, proof of funds, and standard banking procedures. Spanish mortgage advisors specializing in international clients facilitate streamlined approval processes.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca cost of living remains remarkably affordable—typically 30-40% lower than UK equivalents for groceries, dining, utilities, and healthcare. Monthly utility costs average €80-120, supermarket shopping €300-400 monthly, and restaurant meals €12-25. Retirement living is achievable on modest budgets, while rental incomes from holiday properties exceed annual living expenses for many property owners. International healthcare insurance remains inexpensive compared to NHS alternatives.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: De Costa Blanca heeft een mediterraan klimaat with 300+ annual sunshine days, mild winters (12-18°C), and warm summers (28-32°C). Rainfall averages 12-15 days yearly, concentrated in autumn months. Sea temperatures range from 13°C (February) to 26°C (August), providing year-round swimming possibility. The elevated position in Gata de Gorgos ensures cooling breezes mitigating summer heat while capturing spectacular seasonal light for photography and outdoor living.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from UK?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is approximately 900 miles from London, with flight times of 2.5-3 hours from major UK airports including London Stansted, Luton, and East Midlands. Alicante-Elche Airport, 55 minutes from Gata de Gorgos, operates multiple daily direct flights throughout the year, making weekend and extended trips remarkably convenient. Alternative routes via Barcelona (5 hours drive) or Valencia (2 hours drive) provide additional flexibility.
